data.description: This setting defines the height of the first layer of your print. The initial layer height is usually thicker than the layer height to create a stronger adhesion with the build plate.
data.img_description: The image on the left has a thinner initial layer than the image on the right.
data.hints:
- When the model has a lot of detail on the first layer, it might have a decreased quality because of the thicker layer. This limitation can be compensated for with the 'initial layer horizontal expansion' setting, which is found under the Shell category.
- The initial layer line width and print speed also affect the adhesion to the build plate.
data.notes: Note: Automatic bed leveling works best with the initial layer height of the default profiles, be careful when adjusting it.
